content:
Yes, I can provide some information on the overall success of athletes at the 2014 Commonwealth Games. In terms of overall medal count, Australia finished at the top of the medal table with a total of 137 medals, followed by England with 174 medals and Canada with 82 medals. Scotland, which hosted the 2014 Commonwealth Games, finished fourth with a total of 53 medals. The 2014 Commonwealth Games were considered a success for many athletes, with numerous records broken and memorable performances, particularly in athletics, swimming, and gymnastics.

As for how this compared to previous years, it's important to note that the number of participating nations and events can vary from year to year, creating some variability in medal counts and overall success. That being said, the 2014 edition of the Commonwealth Games saw more than 4,950 athletes from 71 nations compete in 17 different sports, making it one of the largest and most competitive Commonwealth Games ever held.
